1.content:
Jason nuzzled into the sweater of his mother enjoying the sweet smell of the freshly laundered fabric. The sun tried to squeeze his eye open but he resisted. If he got up his mother would stop gently stroking his head. She was playing with the wisps of hair on the top of his head twisting them around her before combing them free again.

"It is time to get up sweetie," her lips kissed the top of his head.

His face scrunched up as he pulled into her body more tightly trying to hold on.

"Bad people have come to Crystal Lake and people like the ones who parted us," he knew he had to get up, they could hurt his Mother again if he allowed them too but it hurt to leave. "The sooner you get up the sooner you can be back with me."

The undead snapped his eye open to the cold darkness of the cave he had taken as his newest home. His Mother could be safe here, he lit a candle and saw her mummified head emerge from the darkness. He placed the worn hockey mask over his hideous visage so the kids wouldn't laugh at him. He left without a weapon but he wasn't worried because his mother had always told him he was creative.

He wondered what he would be dealing with out there.
1.title: Jason Lives!

11.content:
Hodder’s Reformatory School written in bright letters but the passengers had serious doubts about the welcome as they saw the fences lined with barbed wire. The bus rode through a tunnel of trees to the camp with dull gray buildings. A guard tower overlooked the entire camp with the requisite guard watching them with mirrored glasses staring down all of the new arrivals.

A police officer escorted the newest arrivals of the vehicle and happily left them to giant threatening to burst out of the shirt after he signed the form for them.

“You have been seen here to be changed from the losers you are!” the man bellowed. “I am Ajax.”

A snicker escaped one of the new arrival’s lips.

“Do you think my name is funny Matthew?” his voice had turned quiet, little more than a whisper but still held all of the menaces of his looming floor. “I assure you I can and will clean the floor so why don’t you drop to the ground and give me ten.”

“Can you break a twenty?” a few of the others laughed at his joke but punch to his gut brought silence to the crowd.

“I like it when people challenge me, it allows me a chance to show I am in charge,” Ajax lifted the young man by his hair. “You are all here because you are all pieces of shit. I expect you will fight me on this but you will fail because you are weak. You wouldn’t be here if you weren’t. Luckily for you, your families pay me very well to turn pieces of shit into something useful.”

“You can’t hit us, that’s a crime,” Marie spoke up.

“You have made a terrible mistake,” he yanked her head back his hot breath filled her lungs. “Marie is no longer a part of civilization, you aren’t even human anymore. See that beautiful lake over there. A boy drowned there years ago and his body was never found. There have been many bodies that were never found over the years and yours can easily join them.”

Silence reigned over the rest of them as the wicked smile formed on his face. He had them where he wanted them for the moment. It would change as they found the courage again but they would be crushed to dust. After all, he was the master of this place.

Who do you follow
11.title: Hodder's Reformatory School

111.content:
Matthew took a chance to flick the asshole off when his back was turned, petty but he needed a minor victory to regain his confidence. He turned to the room and saw the usual set of losers these places brought in, the dick had been right about that. Most of the kids were drug addicts or petty criminals out to teach Mommy and Daddy a lesson for some attention. They weren’t real criminals like him.

His family was like an armor around him, he should be facing ten to twenty. Instead, he was at the summer camp from hell for the time being. He would make sure Ajax got his in the end but he would have to be careful. The man was a sadist who wouldn’t control his temper so for the time being he would play good little boy.

“Do think it is true?” Max, a scrawny shrimp who would probably be swinging from the rafters in a weak or two.

“Pardon?” Matthew looked at him trying to determine if there was any value to getting to know this boy who was likely not strong enough for the real world much less the monster Ajax.

“What he was saying about the boy drowning in the lake.”

“This place was a summer camp for years, I would be shocked if a dozen people haven’t drowned over the years. People are always doing stupid things that result in death. The truth is he doesn’t have the balls to kill a kid, pick on them or abuse them sure but not take their lives.”

“I wouldn’t be so sure, we have had some campers go missing,” Nick chimed into the newcomers.

“Stop trying to scare the fresh meat,” Matthew looked at the crew-cut kid and smirked. He had bought the shit the asshole was selling. He turned back to Max. “Listen, kid, people leave these places all the time some graduate, a few escapes, and several select the express checkout method.”

“I am telling you Ajax killed kids.”

“You can do better than that. Tell them a true story about this place, like about Jason Voorhees. Now there is a real boogeyman.”

“Don’t mention that shit! Ajax doesn’t like to hear that name!”

“Of course he doesn’t. A pussy like him couldn’t measure up to a real killer so instead, he tries to steal the thunder of someone else. Go back to your corner and pray your balls to descend before you hit forty.”

“You just wait you will get yours.”

“I intend to, don’t worry when I get some pussy I will describe it to you because you know you are never going to see one.”

It felt good to be in control again but he was tired of playing in the minor leagues. He needed to get out of here. So he needed to . . .
111.title: Matthew

112.content:
Marie wanted to cry into her pillow, she didn’t belong in this hell hole but the predatory eyes told her weakness was unwise here. She focused on the hate for her stepmother to burn away her sadness. The woman who had sent her here because she was afraid Maria would tell her father what a monster she was.

“I am Sergeant Branson,” a young man not much older than the girls announced himself. Several girls shriek as they rushed to cover themselves from his leering eyes. “You have ten minutes to be ready. A ten-mile hike in the woods to relieve you of your excess energy.”

“Get out of here!” one of the ladies protested the man not leaving the room with a tossed comb. He laughed as he batted it from the air.

“Eight minutes until the twenty-mile hike!”

Cries of protest were met with a tapping of his watch as he exited the room. Marie rushed to obey the request. Throwing on the bright yellow jumpsuits they had been given. It had large numbers on it to further dehumanize them. Was she only 113 from now on?” It wasn’t even sized properly hanging loosely on her body.

The group gathered outside in a chaotic mass as the girls muttered murderous intentions against their guide who wore a nasty looking grin.

“Surely even ladies as stupid as you can manage a line,” he lifted a prod from his belt and pressed a button igniting a hideous sound as the electricity arced ready for a victim. With a little pushing and shoving the twelve people formed a line. “Much better. I knew you could do this.”

Marie started to relax as she told herself this was just a normal walk in the forest with just a little more cursing and swearing. The beauty of nature surrounded them and you could almost forget you were in a prison camp. A squirrel chittered at them before scurrying up a tree, concern started to fill her as the sun faded from the sky.

“Shouldn’t be heading back?” Marie asked Branson.

The man shook his head, “Welcome to Hodder’s Lodge!”

Branson waved towards a large building on the crest of a hill just ahead.

“You are getting a real history lesson, today ladies,” he unlocked the door. Dusty left a film on the place as they entered. “Back in the 1800s old man, Hodder thought he had found the perfect place for a hunting lodge. Turns out he was wrong, lost all of his money and ended up killing his wife and kids. Ajax thought it would be nice to name his school after someone with a similar temperament to him. I don’t suggest any of you screwing up this school he has going results might be similar. Have a good night.”

He went to the second floor and slammed a door shut not inviting any further discussion. The group was left with no food or water and the chill of the night was coming on.

Marie wondered what she should do.
112.title: Marie

1121.content:
“We should get a fire going before it gets too dark,” Maria suggested.

“Too late for that,” Lucy peered out the window at the darkness already fallen over the land.

This caused Maria to pause at the door. She hated the darkness but a shiver propelled her forward into the seemingly endless void. Better to face the danger out there than to slowly freeze to death. To say she was pleased when she heard several of the others follow her.

“Alright bitches, let us get this over with,” a goth girl called Meg shoved her way out. “I don’t suppose I could convince us to start a fire here and roast the balls off of the asshole inside.”

Several of the girls laugh but none made an attempt at piling wood around the place. Maria for her part could find no way to laugh at the demise of someone. Most of the girls were sticking close to the trail grabbing small branches but she knew they wouldn’t last long. Gathering her courage she used it to shove forward to find some logs.

The sounds of the others giggling and laughing as they worked seemed far away. As if they a television in the background. It was the forest that was all too real. In the distant, she caught a glimpse a tall shadowy figure. She leaned closer attempting to squint her eyes to better see it. Tree branch, it is just a tree branch she told herself as something grabbed hold of her.

Her shriek froze everyone. Most fled for the safety of the lodge but laughter came from Meg who was holding Maria’s arm.

“You are a regular scream queen!” Meg helped her gather the logs. “Hurry up, my tits are about to shatter from the cold.”

Maria nodded as she peered back to a shadowy spot in the woods but the figure was no longer there. She tried to tell herself it wasn’t the right spot or it had just been a tree branch in the dark but a large part of her wouldn’t believe it. It was a man out there.

“What should we do to entertain ourselves?” Lucy asked as she poked at the small fire they had started. “Because I have some definite ideas . . .”
1121.title: Gather Firewood

113.content:
Lucas cursed as he tripped and fell into the mud. His buddies snickered behind him, he rewarded them with an extended middle finger. He didn’t dare risk yelling at them because they were getting close to the camp and they would have to watch for guards if they were to get there friend out.

“I can’t wait to be able to turn on the flashlights again,” Lucas muttered as they came to the fence line of the main camp. His pulse increased as he saw all of the defenses.

Barbwire lined the top of the fence and there was even guard towers in each of corners. Spotlights scanned the bushes and trees but the haphazard manner suggested it was more boredom than effort. For a heartbeat, he froze as the light halted over their little group but it moved on. He was certain it had seen them but no alarm was raised so there was still hope.

Moving quickly he raced up to the fence and used his bolt cutters to start cutting the fencing. It was behind one of the buildings near a bush so it wasn’t likely to be spotted right away. A branch nearby snapped causing him to abandon his project as he rushed back to the cover of the bushes.

“What was that!?!” he hissed to the others. Duke held up a broken branch and smiled.

“Just testing to see how alert you were,” he chuckled. Lucas struck him in the shoulder.

“Don’t sweat it,” Zack stepped in between them. “They totally saw us in the tower and they don’t care. The asshole in charge likely stocks the towers with the kids. We can totally coast from here.”

In an instant, his head was replaced with a sledgehammer splattering the group with blood. There was no time for mourning or even a well-placed scream as the hand of the hockey-masked killer wrapped his hand around Zack’s throat choking off any protest. Lucas rushed forward but was slapped aside as if he was a pesky fly dropping him in a lump.

He could barely make out his friend’s struggle as the blur started to fade from his vision but soon things became clear. Jason was lifting Duke high above his head bringing him down with tremendous force against the trunk of a tree. No gymnast in the world could match the angle of that snapped spine. The killer dropped his forcibly folded friend with his insides spilling out on the ground where the flesh had split.

Lucas scrambled to his feet as deadly intentions were turned to him by the masked figure. Jason cocked his head as if debating what method of death best fit his next target. A hard swallow was all the time he needed to decide to get out of here. His feet were moving before he realized where he was going. It dawned on him he was . . .
113.title: Lucas

12.content:
Dr. Mary Crews flipped through the cameras her people had planted all around the camp making sure all of them were running with clear images. She was determined to prove her father had been right about the existence of the paranormal. Tina Shepard had stonewalled her, it was unfair considering she was responsible for the death of her father. Unfortunately, the lawsuit she had failed but Mary wouldn’t let that stop her, she had come up with a plan.

It had taken years to accomplish what she had wanted but it was all finally in place. Dr. Crews had gathered some of the most promising psychics and paranormal researchers in the world. Father’s Institute, as well as the life insurance, had given her this chance as well as her book profits. She had chosen Crystal Lake for all of the strange phenomenon that had happened over the years.

Tina had been at her most powerful here, did this place have a ley line that could have supplied her with the energy she had needed to accomplish those amazing things. The psychic had quieted down about what had actually happened after the wild ravings of the first reports to the police but Dr. Crews was certain they held the most truth.

She had been most curious about the story of the killer returning from the grave. There were plenty of stories of ghosts out there but the stories she had compiled were far different. The spoke of a corporeal being who despite numerous claim of death kept returning. If it was possible for one person to return from the grave than it should be possible for another. The world would be hers if she could pull away from the secret, though most people wouldn’t want to come back as a homicidal, rotting, corpse it was a place to start.

“What are your thoughts on Jason Voorhees?” She asked her head of security Dexter.

“A dead kid is an easy person to blame murders on when people are foolish enough to believe it,” he was a man who needed to be doing something, he paced the room waiting for her to be released. If she didn’t let him go soon he wore a hole through to the first floor.

“So a bunch of different people went on murder sprees according to your “rational” mind.”

“People don’t need much reason to do evil things. I find it much more “rational” than a man coming back from the dead to kill people. To my understanding, there have only been a couple of others to do that and they were in the bible.”

“So precedence has been set.”

“Do you really want to hang your hat on that? As I recall Jesus and Lazarus were one time performances and I don’t recall them doing any killing sprees.”

“Perhaps after this weekend you will be a believer, I have brought in some of the greatest psychics . . .”
12.title: Crews Paranoral Society

121.content:
It was hard to tell if Addison was a beauty or not with how much she did to cover herself. A baggy dark sweater and sweat pants were just the first layer against touching any part of the world. Amazing things could be revealed to her with a simple touch. Lost pasts and forgotten memories were revealed but at a cost as they slammed into her mind. Far too often it was the dark and depressing things showing themselves to her affairs, abuses, and murder. How many times had she died? How many times could you die before you were no longer alive?

So why was she here in this place of death? Life costs money so she would use her curse to survive. It would be a long time before she would have to work again with the money she was given for a week's work. She could go back to her home where she never had to touch something another had felt.

“Could you remove the mask?” Dr. Crews requested.

Involuntarily Addison’s gloved hand reached up to touch the mask which was her latest armor against the world. A feather had struck her face sending her into convulsions as it revealed a serial killer. The man liked to mix pleasure with pain, her hands clasped over her ears as she heard the hideous laughter gave. She felt as he dragged a feather over her peeled away skin. Somehow she managed to stifle a scream.

“It is for my protection,” Addison responded, her voice was barely a whisper as she struggled to stop herself from hyperventilating.

“I will give you an additional thousand dollars,” the doctor eyed her closely but she didn’t know for what. Perhaps she enjoyed making others go against their desires.

“For how long and where?”

“Just when you are in front of me and only when we are indoors so you don’t have to worry about an experience like the Bird Man happening.”

“Okay.”

Addison hated herself for selling herself like some whore on a street corner but it was money she could use to escape reality. She pulled off her mask causing her burgundy hair to tumble out. Even without the assistance of makeup, her face held the beauty of a fawn with eyes full of fear of the world around her.

“I would like you to demonstrate your power for me,” the doctor laid out several items.

Addison eyed the plastic covered packages as if they were poison, she was certain none of them would be harmless. One of them contained a scrap of blue fabric, it looked like it might be from a sweater. She lifted the second object to light, it appeared to be a hard piece of something worn and dirtied by a lot of time. Finally, she came to the last item, some thin blond hair was in this bag.

“You only have to pick one for now,” her viper’s smile waited for an answer. “Which one will you pick?”
121.title: Addison Famed Psychometry

1211.content:
The sweater was known, how could it not be? Anyone who read about the case in any detail saw the pale blue clothing on the headless form of Pamela Voorhees. Addison swallowed hard as she brought the plastic bag close to her. If she could handle the worst of it, the madness of Jason’s mother, she could handle the rest. Jason was likely a child-like mind that didn’t understand that what he was doing was wrong. She suspected the hair was from a victim, she didn’t want to feel the death of an innocent but she had felt them many times before so it would be nothing new.

Her eerily pale hand was revealed as she pulled it free of the glove. It shook as it approached the object knowing the consequences of what awaited it. The young psychic tried to focus on the money she would have soon but it was no good. Visions of death and mayhem whispered to her even before she touched it. Addison finally plunged past her block and touched it causing her body to convulse as the visions took control of her body from her.

Why couldn’t the Christy’s understand how dangerous this place was? She wondered as she lit the kitchen on fire. More children would die if she didn’t stop them. Pamela was safely in the woods by the time anyone noticed the fire. Flames would soon destroy all of that expensive equipment if they couldn’t protect that how could they hope to defend something as precious as a child?

The laughter of the group could be heard as they prepared for dinner. They still hadn’t gotten the message so it looked like she would have to send them another. The cook was out smoking and not watching the stew so she slid inside to add a special ingredient. There would a lineup at every bathroom and sink this night, she smiled as she poured the liquid in before casually leaving as if she had never been there.

Addison struggled against the mind of the madwoman as the terrible visions kept trying to force there was in. She pushed them down and she could see the withered face of Pamela’s corpse staring at her. It was unwilling to give up on life. Pamela was banging on the wall between life and death.

“My boy needs me!” she begged as the light of reality started to burn her way into nothing.

Drool leaked from her mouth as she became aware of the world, especially the stare of Dr. Crews. Wiping her lips she scrambled to put her glove back on and return to the chair as if nothing had happened to her but she could feel the burn of embarrassment on her cheeks. She was a circus monkey who had just performed her trick.

“Not a bad performance but what did you see?” Dr. Crews interrogated her.
1211.title: The Sweater

12111.content:
“Pamela is alive,” Addison shuddered as she remembered the murderous spirit trying to enter her.

“That would be hard to do with her head detached from the body,” an exasperated sigh came from Dr. Mary Crews. “Didn’t you read any of the literature? This basic fact can be found everywhere online. How did you earn an amazing reputation if this is the best you can pull off?”

“Not alive as in walking around as we do. She is still here and aware, the psychotic woman won’t move on without her boy. Pamela is looking for a way back into this world. With all of this psychic energy in the air, she might be able to find a way back in. We have to make sure to block her out from this place, cut off this event if we have to.”

Dr. Crews examined the psychic as if she was a frog to be dissected. Piece by piece taking her apart until she found what she wanted, the truth. The young woman before her actually believed this. It would be interesting if it was true but no one had reported seeing the spirit of Pamela in all of the years since her death. No, wait, that wasn’t true there was one woman who had said she saw Pamela.

She believed her name was Ginny and she had reported seeing a corpse coming out of the water to attack her. It was chalked up to a hallucination induced by stress but it could be the sort of evidence she was looking for. If Pamela was trying to connect to the world of the living she would be a prime source to get evidence from. There really was only one way to find out.

“Do you think she would be more receptive to a medium, a spirit board, or some other method?” Dr. Crews asked.

“Are you insane!?!” Addison screamed. “Any of those would draw her out. The medium might even give her exactly what she wants. She is dangerous. The kills from her son have likely started to make her stronger. Pamela could harm or kill someone if she gets too powerful. Heaven only knows what will happen if they are reunited in this world.”

“Don’t worry. I have taken precautions against both Jason and any otherworldly things. Tonight I think we will try. . .”
12111.title: Warn her about Pamela

122.content:
Sienna practically burst from the large van she arrived in. She had grown up her entire life being told what a gift she had from her family who encouraged her in any way they could. This was a chance for her to prove to the world what her parents had known all along, she was special. Amulets and crystals covered her arms, legs, and her neck in noisy concert which announced her arrival from a long way off. Her crew of cohorts joined her outside of the vehicle slower.

“I can feel them,” Sienna bubbled. “The spirits are everywhere and they want to talk. We are going to do a lot of good here.”

“As long as some of that good goes to the bank accounts,” her brother Clive grumbled.

“Why do you always concern yourself with such earthly concerns? We are putting such good karma into the world the universe shall surely provide for us.”

He snorted, “The universe has certainly provided a lot for us, debt.”

“Enough you two,” Gretchen interceded. “This job is paying us enough we can cut out a lot of the red and she has even said we could do filming for our show. The future is looking good as long as we don’t buy any more ancient ‘relics.’”

“We are stepping up to a new stage. She needed to upgrade things.” Crow, Sienna’s boyfriend responded. He wore nearly as much jewelry and makeup as his girlfriend with a thick array of death-themed ink covering most of his exposed skin. “You will be thanking me when Jason shows up with his machete.”

“Listen, I am not saying I want to die but if Jason has to put a machete up my ass to see that prick dead it will be worth it,” Seth, the cameraman whispered to Gretchen who snorted an agreement. “I am going to check around the location and get some shots while the light is still good.”

“I, as usual, will be acting as a human pack mule and get all of our stuff to our rooms,” Clive started to become a wall of bags before apathetically walking towards the cabin on the property which had been reserved for them.

“It would probably be best if you go to greet our host,” Gretchen suggested as Sienna twirled in the sunlight.
122.title: Sienna Renowned Medium

123.content:
Lawrence rode in the back of his Cadillac contemplating what he had brought him to such a desperate situation. If his luck hadn’t run south on him he would be sipping on a warm brandy by the fire but the cards said it wasn’t to be. He was certain the dealers had cheated him, they likely got paid a bounty for each person they drew every last cent. Still, he had to keep up appearances if he wanted to get back on his feet.

There were plenty of people willing to give him loans which he would have to pay back at large interest. Lawrence only needed enough money to get him through to next month when he had a couple of celebrities will to pay the premium for his services. So he had called up the “good” doctor to accept her generous offer. It was dangerous because he knew the stories of Jason were real but he could keep ahead of the deadly simpleton.

Reaching out with his gift he found the location of Jason became clear to him. Jason watched from across the dark waters as a blond woman stripped naked in the moonlight. He moved into the cool water and started his approach.

“Bet you can’t catch me!” Emily called her boyfriend Brett as she dove into the water. Her creamy white body shone beautifully in the moonlight.

Brett shook his head, “We have a perfectly warm bedroom at a hotel waiting for us with a heated pool I might add.”

“I thought you were going to be more adventurous.”

“It is hard to be adventurous when your penis freezes off.”

“That would be too bad. But I promise if you come in I’ll warm you up and I do mean up.”

Looking around he almost hoped to see someone so he wouldn’t have to go in the water but there was no last-minute save. Brett winced with each hesitant step he took. He knew if he didn’t go in the water she would make him pay for it in other ways. Just as he was about halfway in his girlfriend splashed him with the water.

“Stop it or I’ll put you over my knee!” Brett growled at her.

“Promises, promises!” She dove under the water.
123.title: Lawrence Celebrated Clairvoyent

124.content:
Tristen stared at the spoon trying to will it to move but it stood still. Once again it was likely he would have to depend on charm and parlor tricks to get him through. He had moved objects before. At least he thought he had but as time expanded between events he grew less certain. His family had a long line of famed psychics in history and he was the only one who had shown any signs of the “gift.”

It didn’t take him long to discover it wasn’t one he could easily command and failure was not allowed. Tristen wondered how many of his ancestors were really charlatans like him. Thankfully in the days of the internet learning to be a fake was easy. There were many who would say it was essential to be a fake on the internet. The abuse had stopped and praise had started when he had mastered the tricks of the fraud trade.

“You don’t have to come with me,” he hinted at his sister Fay as they got out of the car. “I can use the bathroom all by my self even.”

“This isn’t about you,” Fay double-checked her makeup in the mirror. “I have to think of the future of our family. Some of the people here are going to be the most powerful psychics in the world. If we are to restore our position we need to add their blood to our own. You certainly aren’t doing us any good. Our parents and grandfather might have been tricked by you but I know you are a fake.”

No response came to mind. A part of him had suspected she knew or was at least suspicious.

“Don’t worry. I won’t out you. If they aren’t bright enough to see you for a fraud they don’t deserve to know.” Years of abuse laced her words with hate. “At least you can still bring in money to the family. Go talk to the head and I will go talk to the others.”

His sister loosened a button to reveal a healthy amount of cleavage before stalking off to hunt prey. Tristen was tempted to give a warning to the others but he had his own lioness to face.
124.title: Tristen Reputed Telekinesis

13.content:
“Why do we have to do this shit?” Marcus bitched again. “We weren’t the ones to kill the dude.”

Angelo rubbed his temples, “I am begging you, please, shut up. Work is work.”

“Fuck no! Work, this is not work, this is shit duty, especially when this job can get you ten to twenty.”

“Than how about you help me get this body buried so we aren’t out here all night. At least this isn’t some fat ass like the other week.”

The man grunted something like acceptance as they got out of the car to grab the body. Fall had finally arrived causing the men to pull their jackets tighter. It wouldn’t be long for the road would be covered in snow and the ground far too hard to dig.”

“How long before the cops figure out we switched the lock on this gate?” Marcus slid the chain loose.

“Probably never, the sheriff is terrified of this place,” Angelo responded.

“So why can’t we dump the body in one of the cabins if the cops don’t come here?”

“Because stupid teenagers do and the police would have to do something if they reported finding a body.”

Leaves tumbled by the heads as they made their way down the road, which was being generous as more holes and plants were there than a roadway. They bounced around as the suspension tried to compensate but it could only do so much. The skeletons of the cabins could be seen in the distance like a graveyard of better times.

“I think we can do this in one trip, do you want the shovels or the body,” the light of the trunk illuminated a blue tarp.

“Shovel, why don’t we just bury it behind the tree over there, why must we go into the middle of the woods,” his partner whined.

“I swear my daughter whines less when I tell she is grounded. Someone is more likely to spot the disturbed earth near the camp. I am the one carrying all of the weight so quit your bitching.”

“Why do you have to be such an asshole!?! I just don’t want to be out here in the middle of podunk nowhere.”

“Shit, don’t tell me you believe in the boogeyman? Grow a pair.”

Mario hesitated to say more, the man clearly thought the stories were absurd but talking helped him. The woods were enclosing upon them, the light was fading from the world, and he was hearing something in the woods near them. He stopped and the footsteps he heard would cease as well. Someone was with them.

He rushed forward to catch up, “Someone is in the woods, we need to do something.”

Angelo tossed the body to the ground, “You want to do something how about . . .”
13.title: Savini Crime Family

131.content:
“Are you sure? I could stay to help you out if you wanted,” relief poured over Marcus’s face.

“I am carrying a dead body, right? Well, it might be a good idea for you to make sure there are no witnesses.” Angelo responded. “There might be some horny teenagers around that need to be sent away.”

“Well if you are sure.”

He raced off to the sound with his gun out, Marcus wasn’t about to let himself to be scared away by a legend. The cool steel kept him connected to reality, Jason started to become a myth an illusion to keep local girls virgins. He slowed his pace as he heard something out there.

“Hello! Anyone out there!” A man in just a pair of boxers yelled. “See, I told you no one was around for miles.”

An attractive brunette didn’t seem so certain, “I am telling you I heard something.”

“This is the woods, Beth. It could have been a squirrel or a chipmunk. Please don’t let Rocky the fucking squirrel ruin our fun.”

“If I find out one of your pervert friends is filming this Alex, I will cut off your balls and feed them to you.”

“I wouldn’t do that to you, honey.”

Marcus lifted his pistol feeling the jolt of adrenaline as he aimed at the pair shifting between targets feeling like a god. They would live or die because of his squeezing of the trigger or if he was feeling merciful he could scare them off. Perhaps if the girl was to do something for him. He stepped out of the woods confident in his Alpha dominance.

A staggering man entering the scene frozen the thought. The tip of a machete dripped blood out of his chest as he struggled to stay erect. Finally, his fight for life stopped as he dropped into the small fire, his camera was still recording as another figure entered the campsite.

Jason’s looming figure could barely be seen in the embers of fire flying in the air. He eyed each of the targets debating between targets. The gun was of little concern to him as little more than an annoyance. Beth shrieked as she struggled to her feet from the confines of her sleeping bag. None of the men took time appreciated her perky breasts in the moon. Alex lifted a fiery log from the fire pit and waved it at the hockey-masked killer.

All of them would have to die but who would be first.
131.title: Go check it out

choices: Cut through the woods for the girl
1312.content:
The pause as he decided who to kill next allowed Alex to act. His hand hurt from the heat of being so close to the flame but he swung with all of his might into the throat of the dead thing in front of him. Rotten flesh sizzled befouling the air, the only reaction from the killer was a slight tilt of the head. Jason hand wrapped around the sizzling charcoal as he yanked it from the grip of the man.

“No! You can’t do this!” Alex screamed as the flaming object grew large in his eyes. He squirmed and struggled with all of his might. His attacker had deadly jamming the burning log down the screaming throat. Blood and fire fought to suffocate the man as his flesh blistered. Jason lost interest in the dying man and tossed him on his friend's mutilated corpse.

“You aren’t real!” Marcus squeezed the trigger on his pistol but it didn’t make the phantom become any less real. The force pushed the killer back a step, embolden the criminal stepped forward to fire again with equal results. “You aren’t so tough! You are just a man!”

Jason fell to the ground and lay still.

“Nothing a little application of lead can’t take care of,” he nervously laughed as he unloaded the rest of his rounds into the body. Cautiously he drew closer looking for any signs of life, no movement of the chest and no twitch of the muscle gave a sign of animation to Marcus. To be safe he reloaded his gun. “Sorry brother but you didn’t have a big enough gun to take care of this. Don’t worry, I will keep the hot little bitch of yours just what she needs.”

His thoughts of sexual conquest vanished as Jason planted a tent spike into his leg. Marcus’s howl of pain did nothing to slow the attack. He was yanked from his feet as Jason tore the spike from the man’s leg. Marcus scrambled to move despite the daze of his head hitting the ground but the palm of the dead man hit his chest. It was bad enough to have one Jason but now there were three or four of the monster depending on the moment.

“Don’t, stop,” it came as a whimpering sob as the deadly figure drew his arm back, he couldn’t believe what was happening. He was being staked to the ground like some sort of fucking vampire.

Blood spurted up from the deathblow as if Jason was drilling for blood. For a moment it seemed like there would be an endless supply of it but the organ pumping it quickly stopped.

“Help! Somebody help me!” the cry for help from the girl was distant but he could hear it as if it was a dinner bell. But he knew there was someone else in the woods, the partner to the man he just killed.
1312.title: Alex

132.content:
Angelo threw the body to the ground. “Dig.”

He didn’t wait for any protest though he was sure he would hear some. At least checking on the noise would get him away from the yammering of the young man. Angelo listened to the woods trying to find the sound that had disturbed Marcus.

“Why do I have to dig!” Angelo ground his teeth at the whining.

“Because I am going to go kill Jason fucking Voorhees!” Angelo screamed, fuck it if someone heard them he would make the loser dig a larger hole.

The young man could hear the hate in the voice and decided it might be best to let things go for the moment. He would tell him off later, yeah later. For the moment he dug the hole mumbling and cursing his partner.

For his part, Angelo felt his blood pressure lower as Marcus’s voice vanished into the woods. He needed to get the asshole in the woods more because there was nothing out here. At least nothing dangerous. Squirrels were noisy creatures running through branches or the underbrush even more than a deer. A coyote announced itself but it was hardly the stuff to produce nightmares.

A loud crack drew his attention to the masked figure. Someone was playing games in the woods tonight wearing a hockey mask like the killer of legend. The man held the pieces of the branch he broke like a pair of spears.

“Nice costume buddy but your night is over,” Angelo lifted his gun and pulled the trigger. The slug lodged into the mask but Jason remained upright.

Jason flung the first spear in response striking the man in the gut. A second and third shot followed but they were wild as the man crumpled in pain. The remaining branch speared through the man’s forearm pinning it to the ground.

“Fuck you! You motherfucking son of a bitch! I am going to take this stick and shove it . . .” His rant was cut off by foot being placed on his throat. Angelo felt the pressure growing as Jason pressed down slowly. He tried to shift the massive undead from his body but there was breaking free.

Just before he blacked out relief came as the pressure vanished. As he sputtered and coughed he the descending foot of Jason Voorhees. Instinctively he thrust his free hand in the way but it only joined his face in being smeared across the forest floor.
132.title: Start digging and I will go look

133.content:
“We have guns and shovels,” Angelo dropped the body deciding this spot was good. Any further and he was certain Marcus would run home to hold on his mama’s apron strings. “If there is anyone out there they are going to be having a much worse day dealing with us.”

“Yeah, you are right,” he pulled out his pistol and slowly circled with the weapon at the ready as if it would ward off danger.

“Alright Dirty Harry put it away and get to shoveling since I carried the body.”

“Let me just have a cigarette first.”

“First sensible thing you have said all night.”

Both of them took a moment to ignite there cigarettes never noticing the masked figure just off in bushes as the light illuminated him. As the light faded he faded back into the night moving in for the kill but first he needed to collect something.

“Hey, where did you put the shovel?” Marco frowned as he looked where his partner had left it or at least thought he had.

“Are you an idiot!?! It is right there!” the cigarette danced in his mouth as he talked but he was brought to stunned silence as he didn’t see the shovel where it had been set down. It didn’t take long to find it as it slammed into Angelo’s face squashing the lit cigarette as well as numerous facial bones.

Jason watched with satisfaction as the man dropped next to the corpse he had brought with him. Marco suddenly collected himself and went for his gun but he didn’t prove to be as fast on the draw as Jason was with a shovel. The blade lifted the man from the ground and stabbed through his gut and spine sticking him to a tree.

“Let me down, I have to go home,” the mobster pleaded but the monster of Crystal Lake ears were not open to mercy for a dying man.

Angelo was struggling to see with blood flooding his eyes, “You motherfucker! I am going to cut your dick off and stuff it down your throat!”

The hockey-masked killer snapped off a piece of the shovel handle. Angelo’s eye widened just in time to see himself get staked to the ground like a vampire. Jason stalked off for more prey.
133.title: Forget about it

1332.content:
It was hard to make a buck as a towing and mechanic service in the middle of nowhere but Buddy had found a way. He thanked the heavens for Jason and the dark work he did in the woods. Growing up he had seen the parade of vehicles taken to rot away in an impound yard and decided he could do better by them.

Hard work and being willing to take some risk was the name of the game for getting ahead in the world. Buddy made sure he studied vehicle identification numbers or VIN and how to remove them. At the start, he didn’t even have a tow truck. The young man had to hotwire some of the cars because he certainly didn’t want to go in the woods looking for bodies.

“Are you ready my darling daughter?” His daughter hadn’t been sure what she had wanted to do so he had brought her into the family business.

“Why do we have to get up so early?” dark glasses hid the face of Kyra. A waft of booze was still lingering on her from a night of heavy drinking.

“This is the time of least activity. Like you, Jason is not a morning person so this is the safest time.”

Buddy wondered if the police knew what he was up to. They had to have noticed the number of vehicles they were finding had diminished. He suspected they had less crap to deal with and they didn’t care how it happened. If they had no evidence of the missing people in their town they could just send the people down the road.

“So what will you do if you see Jason?” Kyra touched the shotgun he had mounted in the truck.

“Leave, I have no interest in being a dead hero and I don’t want you to be on either.” Buddy turned down the first of many roads into the woods. Hunting cares was a bit like fishing. You had to drop a lot of hooks into the water if you wanted to catch anything.

It would be easy to forget how dangerous this was. Rays of golden light magically lit up the forest. Birds chirped and sang at a glorious new day. Why shouldn’t they be happy, an undead killer wasn’t stalking them.

“How are you paying me?” Kyra demanded as she played on her phone.

“I love the mercenary spirit,” Buddy smiled. “You truly are my child. Tell you what, I will let you decide. I can pay you by the day or give you 10% of what I make from sales.”

She sat back and rocked as she thought. Buddy turned down another drive being careful to not talk. He didn’t want to sway her. You learned things better if you learned the lesson on your own.

“Percentage,” Kyra spoke with hesitation afraid of the response.

“Good choice, you are thinking of the future,” he gave her a little hug. “Looks like you might have hit the jackpot.”

A brand new Cadillac came into view with no one in sight. He pulled up carefully for a hookup and got out of the car. Buddy took a quick look around but he didn’t hear or see anything human and he certainly wasn’t going to call out to them.

“I am going to hook up. You be ready to haul ass out of here,” his daughter nodded.
1332.title: Buddy's Towing

13322.content:
Kyra was tempted to throw on the radio to distract herself. This was the first time her dad had trusted her in coming out here but more importantly, she was scared. She had grown up with the legend of Jason Voorhees and knew just how many people the monster had managed to kill. As tough a front as she put up she knew the score if she met the legend.

Her body as there was a bang on the hood as she had turned her head to see a single eyeball staring back at her.

The shriek caused Buddy to jerk his head up slamming into hard steel. His vision was blurred as he dragged himself from underneath the vehicle. Fresh blood started to well done in one eye forcing him to keep it shut. He knew it was his daughter would was screaming and he needed to do something to save her even if he had to face down with Jason himself.

To his astonishment, there was a raven munching on the ocular juices of a human eyeball on the hood of his truck. Buddy started to laugh in relief as he wiped awe the blood and headed back to work.

“It isn’t fucking funny,” Kyra screamed.

“I know but I am just glad you are okay,” Buddy gave her a smile. “I’ll hurry up so we can get out of here. I think we have had enough excitement for one day.”

The young woman turned back to the raven who seemed to look satisfied with himself. Her glare made no difference to the animal.

“Get out of here you filthy creature!” she banged on the windshield.

It just cawed in response as if say “Nice Try.”

“Sorry little buddy it is time for us to go,” Buddy hopped into the vehicle. The raven seemed to understand the man’s words and flew off into a tree to observe their departure. “If you ever have any problems whatsoever starting the vehicle you never take out.”

She nodded as they rumbled away down the road. Kyra’s heart only slowed when they finally hit the asphalt of a proper road. It was as if they were passing across a marker of Jason’s territory. The dollar signs started to float into her head when they finally arrived back at the shop.

It was time to go back to business as usual. He only checked the roads once a week. There was little reason to do otherwise.
13322.title: An unexpected visitor

14.content:
Hank walked the edge of the woods trying to avoid the overwhelming lights of the facility but more importantly the cameras. Turning to the woods he took a quick swig and winced as it gave him a mule’s kick to him. Payday was soon so he would be able to get himself something that didn’t threaten to kill him with each shot.

“With McLoughlin’s money you would think the bastard could afford to pay me better?” he muttered as he returned to patrol. “Working as a security guard here, they should be giving me hazard pay.”

A twig snapped but he ignored it, they weren’t paying him enough to go in those woods. Not after some delinquent teenagers and certainly not after the monster of these woods. His pace quickened as he gave the woods a wide berth just in case it was something larger than a squirrel. Another fifty feet and he would be inside the gate but that would mean he wouldn’t be able to take another drink for a while.

His flashlight caught nothing but fallen branches and leaves stirring on the ground from the wind. Hank leaned back to take a large swallow, bracing for the impact it would have. As his eyes came down the cold stare of Jason Voorhees waited patiently for him. The rusted machete slammed home causing the man to release a bloody mixture of blood and bile on his attacker.

Jason paused only paused a moment at the forboding McLoughlin Medical Research building. Barbwire fencing surrounded it and floodlights burned away any shadows. The only windows in the place were tiny slats more in line for a medieval castle than a modern structure. Entry was gained through heavy metal doors giving an impregnable feel to it. He intended to put it to the test.

Dr. McLoughlin watched over the head of the security’s shoulder to observe where the missing guard was. They eventually found the video feed of the man being dragged off into the woods or rather his corpse.

“We have to call the police,” Luther, the head of security announced as he reached for the phone.

“If you feel you must,” the doctor was scribbling notes. “I hardly think the death of a drunk is worth the hassle of talking to the police.”

Luther scanned the man’s face to see if he was joking but as always the man’s face was devoid of expression as if the whole world bored him. It was true the man was a drunk but he didn’t deserve to die forgotten with no grave over his head.

“People will ask questions about him eventually,” he tried to push his boss to agree. “They will have more questions if they find out we hid this from them.”

The man paused before responding, “You should . . .”
14.title: McLouglin Medical Research

141.content:
Dr. Samuel McLoughlin finally decided it was best to contact the police. It would prevent there from being trouble later. He had been surprised at how nonchalant the person at the office was when he announced the death of a man at his facility. The woman on the phone had informed him the sheriff would be by shortly.

At the very least the man was prompt, it wasn’t ten minutes before the police car arrived. There were no lights or sirens to announce the arrival of law enforcement. The camera showed a fit-looking silver-haired man walked to the door.

“One of our security guards, Hank got himself killed,” Luther played the security tape.

“I will make a note of it,” Sheriff Corman responded. He turned to exit the room.

“Is that all!?!” the doctor asked shock pouring into his voice.

“What more do you want me to do?” a bored look crossed the chief’s face. “If you would recall our prior conversation I warned you about buying this property. I warned you of the dangers of this property.”

“You can hardly expect me to believe a dead man was actually stalking the grounds.”

“I don’t see how your disbelief in what I said makes any of this my problem. You should move as soon as possible, things start to get messier from here on out.”

“You aren’t going to do anything!?!”

“What would you like me to do? I am not going to risk lives because of your stupidity. If you get his corpse back I will be happy to bury it for you but that is about it. If I could buy up the land around that God-forsaken lake and seal it away from everyone.”

“I am going to contact Mayor Davis and see about having you recalled for failing to do your duty to protect the city.”

“Do you what you think you can. If you like I will light a candle for you.”

Sheriff Corman exited taking a moment to glance at the woods but he saw no hockey-masked killers but he knew at least one was out there. His next course of action would be to contact the committee to determine their next course of action.

Doctor McLoughlin had been surprised at being left to his own choices and wasn’t sure where to take things. He had been left a free hand to deal with the threat in any way he wanted so what did he want to do?

Jason had seen the police car but it had left before he could take out the sheriff. He didn’t really care because there were still many people left to slay. It didn’t really matter for him to who was killed first as long as all of the outsiders ended up dead.
141.title: Call the Police

1413.content:
Jason circled like a shark assessing his prey from the sanctuary of the woods. Cameras were like a hundred ever-vigilant eyes. He didn’t fully understand them but he recalled well the feeling of being stared at as a helpless child. A deformed child who could nothing against the mob of bullies but things were different now.

From the darkness, projectiles fell like a destructive rain upon the facility. Cameras exploded with sparks as they ceased to function. Floodlights burst to shroud things in darkness until only one remained. Eyes tried to pierce the night as a dozen people went to the small windows. He waited until they were straining to the utmost before stepping out into the floodlight.

Fear swelled in his audience as they took in his appearance. Jason held a machete in his hand of rotted flesh. His overalls were stained with the blood of dozens of victims layering over each other in a mosaic of death. Even his mask bore scars of his dark work. Cuts scarred the mask and the markings of the bullet left a large break in the top of the mask. All markings of the many people who had come for him and failed. They had reason to be, his machete sliced the air to the final light allowing the darkness to swallow him.

Dread swelled in the workers but dark joy-filled Jason as he entered his element. The gate was locked but it was barely a delay for him with superhuman strength. Metal complained loudly as it rattled and shook as burst open announcing the approach of the killer.

As he stalked forward he debated where to head first. Jason could enter the building and start ending the intruders right away. The second idea was to go to the parking lot because when people were frightened they tried to leave and he didn’t want anyone to escape. The third option was to go for the power which would eliminate the lights inside the building causing fear and panic which he loved.
1413.title: Follow Jason

142.content:
The head of security was glad to have this trouble off of his hands as he waited for his boss to talk to the military.

”Colonel Wilson,” Dr. McLoughlin made contact with military medical research. “I hope you enjoyed my video file.”

“I have taken a look at them and the information you sent me,” Colonel Simon Wilson voice was monotone. He let things just hang there allowing the dead air to speak his displeasure. The colonel wasn’t interested in ghost stories or boogymen, he was interested in saving lives and taking them.

“The stories about Jason are true,” if he could get the fish to bite he could make a lot of money but this man was used to people trying to sell him on fairy tales and fantasies. Videos could be doctored. “You know my reputation, I suggest you send out some of your people to check out my story.”

“What about the murder? Will this mean police troubles?”

“He was a drunk, no one will miss him.”

“I can spare a few men to see if there is anything to your claim. Be warned that I do not take being jerked around lightly. Have evidence there is something of value for them to examine when they get there and I am not talking about this B-grade slasher film you have made. I want them to have physical proof of a dead man walking in the woods. If you can have the test subject captured so we don’t have to hunt him down, I could see my way to paying you a bonus.”

Before the doctor got to respond further the line went dead and he didn’t think it was because of a bad connection. It left him a lot to ponder about how he was supposed to prove Jason was stalking the woods around Crystal Lake. Footprints would be easy and he could show them the body of the security guard to prove the man was dead. The doctor suspected the colonel’s men would require more.

“I want you and your men to capture Jason,” Dr. Samuel McLoughlin turned to Luther who held a doubtful look to the order.

“What do you want me to do? Strap down a couple of horny teenagers to a pit trap!?!” Luther responded. “If you want to sell him to the military, you catch him. If you pay me and my men a bonus we might go get you some evidence but capturing a monster is not in our job description.”

“A killer with a machete is stalking the woods. That leaves this place insecure, security guard.”

“Sure boss, I will assemble my crack team to get him. Who do you want me to take with me? The lothario who spends half his time on the phone with his harem and the other half trying to screw one of them. Perhaps the young lady who spends her time reading books instead of watching the monitors. Not one of my people is some trained military, police department, or secretly trained assassin.”

This drew a growl from his boss who didn’t like being mock but the man did have a point. These were not the sort to put there lives on the line for him. He had a gold mine in front of him but he didn’t have a good way to extract it. For the moment he might have to settle.
142.title: Contact the Military

143.content:
Dr. Adrian Holmes watched the video in his office for the fifth time. He had already made five pages of notes. It hadn’t taken him long to realize this wasn’t faked. The muscles and movements were too perfect. He had to have this person.

The strength was beyond human and the scars and markings on the body indicated it resist damage that would be lethal to any man on earth. As the head of the biological department, he realized this was worth several fortunes to the right buyer but he was more interested in the good it would do the country and mankind. This could save the lives of soldiers and eventually unlock the secrets of eternal life.

It appeared there was intelligence as the man had laid in wait to ambush the man though he would have to be careful to make sure psychosis was not a side effect of the transformation. The case file suggested Jason may have mental difficulties so perhaps it was just an individual subjects problem. Dr. Holmes decided he should set up tests to check the intelligence of the subject.

Capture would be ideal but for the moment he could test the intelligence and skill of his target. The woods was a prime hunting ground but how active was he?

He rolled his wheelchair over to the phone, “Come in my interns.”

All of the people were desperate to make a name for themselves with the legendary Dr. Holmes. Their careers could be made or broken by him and he was counting on that. To be fair he had made the same risky choices years ago and it had been worth it despite putting him in a wheelchair.

“I have been given evidence of the existence of the local boogeyman Jason Voorhees,” Dr. Adrian eyed them for weakness. “This is going to be dangerous and if you aren’t willing to risk your lives I don’t want you here. I will give you two weeks of wages if you decide to leave.”

The three people looked at each other but none took a step to leave.

“You must think it is worth it,” Melody broke the silence.

“If we are successful all of you will be rich and have perhaps even given humans eternal youth so no pressure,” he laughed before the heard look returned to his face. “But with great rewards come high costs. We will see if you are truly willing to pay the price. For the moment I have work for you to do.”
143.title: Inform Dr Holmes

15.content:
Jason has faced many things over the years but this time the killer may be in over his head. Each of these options offers serious threats to the masked killer.

Somewhere familiar, Camp Sunnydays, a summer camp built over the graveyard of many attempts to bring joy and happiness in this place of darkness and misery. Rebecca Morris is the owner and on the face of things, she is a sweet and bubbly person. Secretly she is in charge of a cult that seeks to pervert the dark energies of this place for her own purposes. The kids are a mix of underprivileged children and orphans who will not be missed but Jason just might but a machete through her plans.

An old world threat, a vampire has taken control of the community of Forest Green. Even the mastery over Crystal Lake is not beneath his notice but there is already one who claims to be master of those shores, Jason. With an array of monsters and people at his, the vampire is no easy pushover and he will tolerate no rival to his power. Will his centuries of knowledge and unearthly power put him into the ground or perhaps chain him to eternal servitude.

Crystal Lake has been turned into a wildlife reserve. Milton Hamilton, a famous billionaire has bought the property and stocked it with exotic and dangerous prey from around the world. He has even held hunts of serial killers before but the awakening of Jason provides a new challenge. People from around the world are brought in, each paying a hefty fee for the chance to take Jason’s head as a trophy. Who is a predator and who is prey can quickly change and Jason demands blood if you want to play a game of death with him?

Entire graveyards have been filled by the legendary killer and this leaves many mourning families in his wake. They are aware of how difficult he is to kill and an organization has been formed to stop his rampage permanently. Some of them bring the latest in science and technology to bear against him. Others seek paths through more mystical and spiritual means viewing him as a supernatural being perhaps removing his attachments to this world or a ritual could stop him. Another group will utilize more mundane methods to end the slaying by trying to trap him forever. All of them and more will have there chance to take a shot at Jason but the notorious slayer of men will not be sitting idly by. When there is killing to be done Jason gets down to business.

Finally, there is always the option of something else. An open door to put your own marker on the legend of Jason’s Crystal Lake. Will it be a zombie apocalypse or a mutant plague he faces when he leaves his home? Perhaps it will be something entirely different from your own imagination and crafting. What dangers will the killer of so many fights face?
15.title: Another Group

151.content:
“I don’t know why I have to do shit,” Trina cut the head off another rabbit spreading the blood into another arcane marker. “Trent should be doing this but he got the special pussy plower’s pass.”

She would have to have a shower before she went back to camp. Couldn’t have the little lambs know they were being fattened for the slaughter. Not-to-be-Named-One demanded a lot in exchange for his boons but they were ready to pay the price. They weren’t the first group to perform the ritual and they wouldn’t be the last one.

Satisfied with her work, Trina headed to the small shower. Tossing her bloody clothes in the bin, Amanda was really good at getting out blood but this might even be too much. Thirteen markers had been laid, good enough for the first circle.

The water was warmed by the sun but certainly not enough. Trina shivered as she wiped away the stickiness. A bang at the door announced the arrival of an intruder.

“Is that you Brad?” thank God it wasn’t one of the kids. Trina could see whoever it was through the crack at the top of the doorway. They were wearing some sort of mask but if they thought she was going to be frightened like some schoolgirl they had another thing coming. “Ready or not here I come!”

Trina but on the flimsy robe and jerked the door open and held her knife to Jason.

“Nice costume Brad but unless you want your dick mounted on my wall I suggest you back off. Brad!?!” she had been certain at first but the hole in the middle of the man told her it might not be Brad. Trina could see the forest behind the hulk in front of her.

With practiced skill, she plunged the knife into the heart of Jason. There was no groan of pain or seepage of blood.

“Back off, I have a connection to The Lurker at the Threshold! I shall have you punished foul thing.” Trina demands sounded almost like a plea.

Jason took the knife from his body as the woman backed into the wall. Her eyes darted around for escape from the place or another defense but there was none to be had. Trina grabbed the forearm of the dead man as it plunged into her chest. The effect was far more detrimental on her than it had been on Jason. Her body slumped leaving Jason alone.

He marched into the woods and spotted the defacement of one of his trees. The symbol filled him with rage. Jason wrapped over the bloodstained marking and tore it from the tree. His heel ground away any recognizability in the wood. He didn’t understand what was happening, it was different from trespassers in his woods, it felt like they were trying to take the woods from him and make them their own.
151.title: Cultists

152.content:
Baxter watched a Christopher Lee Dracula awaiting the sun to set before he stepped outside. He wondered if he should adopt some noble ranking. When he was alive he had been a baker, hardly the stuff of blue-blooded status but the title might remind people to tread lightly around him. At 5’ 7” he was hardly imposing despite being able to tear a bodybuilder apart.

The sun had just faded over the horizon as he stepped outside. This was his favorite time, he could almost feel the sun-kissed warmth upon the land. He had loved to step outside to watch the sunrise as his bread baked in the oven fill the air with their enticing aromas. These days he had to take pleasure from different things.

His mansion was no Gothic castle but it had central heating and air conditioning. What he needed as he extended his power was a daytime guardian. The local boogeyman Jason Voorhees would do nicely. Baxter turned on his night vision and saw the world light up as his eyes glowed red.

“Master, someone might see,” Simon pleaded. The man was good with money but he was a sniveling whiner.

“There is no one around if there were I would see them,” Baxter dismissed the warning. The glow of life could easily be discerned. From the mouse crawling across the forest floor to the watchful owl high in the branches, all of them were visible to him. The only human life was far from here and was nestled in for the night, none of them liked to live this close to dreaded Crystal Lake and he had given them a reason to fear the night. “I am going to take a look for this dead man who walks.”

It was painful shifting to the form of a bat. You were compressing down on yourself forcing your bones and flesh to contort in ways your body was much better. The change into the wolf was much easier but the mist was the best. When you became mist you were letting go it felt like a drug high but you had to be careful with it. Time could easily pass too quickly as you lost hold on the concept of it and you would be caught out in the sun.

For the moment the bat was what he needed for a large survey of the land. He fluttered into the night looking for Jason. His life sight had failed to find Jason but he suspected it was because the man was a walking corpse as cold as the air around him. A swearing man was walking close to the edge of the woods. Not far behind him was a something moving in the woods as silent as the air on a day without a breeze.

Baxter envied Jason and his skill in the woods. A creature of the night he might be but not one of the wilderness. Jason moved as if he was a ghost, his long strides avoided every fallen branch and not a leaf rustled to announced his presence. Only as he drew close to the man did the killer make noise. He loudly snapped a thick branch. Was it to create fear in his target? Or was it a child’s game to give his opponent a chance to escape? The vampire couldn’t be certain.

The human froze in place, “If there is someone out there I am not in the fucking moody for people playing Jason! My tire went flat and it matches the spare and I am in no mood for games! But I still have the tire iron to show you a good time!”

Satisfied with his threat the man continued on his journey.
152.title: Vampire

153.content:
“Welcome my honored pests,” Milton Hamilton announced over a speaker from the safety of his lodge. “Each of you has caused trouble for me but I am a bigger person so I have brought you to my hunting preserve to enjoy all this land has to offer.”

The shipping container they had been brought in remotely opened spreading the fading sun on three young adults. None of them look happy to be there, three days in a metal box will do that to you.

“You can’t do this to people!” Louis the cyber hacker who had held one of his businesses hostage complained. He looked around for someone to aim his anger at but only found a faceless voice box.

“It is clear he has,” Greta, a corporate spy spoke up next. Her eyes looked for a way out of this place. In the distance, she was able to see some cabins. “Are you planning to kill us?”

“Perish the thought, my dear,” Milton’s voice became comforting. “I have never taken a human life. However, you are in the home of one Jason Voorhees who doesn’t ascribe to the same code I do. If you manage to escape I will consider us square and I will let you go on your merry little ways.”

“Let me guess,” Dawson, a thief of hundreds of thousands of dollars. “You are televising our efforts for your enjoyment.”

“And profit,” the billionaire responded. “Fun is fun but profit is profit and all of you have cost me a lot of money.”

“You could afford it.”

“That doesn’t justify your stealing.”

“Nor you leaving us out here with a killer.”

“Touche. Well, worst of luck to all of you.”

“I am going to kill that bastard when I get out of here,” Louis grumbled. “I think our best bet is to stay together.”

“Going to have to disagree with you there,” Dawson said. “Three targets, three times the chances of getting away. I will be generous and let you pick the first direction.”

“What about the one, of us Jason who targets? They won’t have any chance at all.”

“Such is the way the wind blows. One moment you are on a tropical island sipping the fines alcohol Mr. Hamilton’s money can buy and the next you are being hunted by Jason fucking Voorhees. Roll the dice and go because I don’t think the local resident is planning to give us a good head start.”

“I could just follow you.”

“And I could break your leg and provide a nice head start for myself but I am a sporting man.”

Louis turned to Greta to get some support but she was already diving into the lake and swimming across to the cabins. When he had turned back Dawson was holding a thick branch in a batter’s pose.

“Your choice to stay or go,” Dawson took a practice swing within an inch of the hacker’s face causing him to stumble back to the ground. He instantly started scrambling away into the relative safety of the woods. “Good choice.”

Dawson whistle as he jogged into the woods suspicious of the paths nearby. He suspected Hamilton had not made things easy for them.

Who does Jason target first?
153.title: Preserve

1532.content:
Louis kicked a stone in frustration as he walked down the path he had chosen, he would save running for when he saw a real threat. A part of him didn’t believe this was real. It could just be a sick joke by Milton Hamilton as payback before he was sent to the police. He wouldn’t be killed for a little hacking. It wasn’t like he had actually killed anyone.

The jaguar watched the human as he drew closer. It tensed as it readied to pounce on the unaware target. It had learned to hate humans from many years of abuse in a circus. This kill would not be for food but for something it wanted more. The nearly two hundred pound animal landed with grace upon the back of the man digging claws in deeply to hold on for the ride to the ground.

A cry of pain escaped the man as wet incisors of death closed around the back of the neck to end the life. It leaped back as someone stepped from the woods. The jungle cat roared, lips curled to show the dangerous teeth within but no reaction came for the masked figure. He smell strange to the animal he did not have blood flowing through his veins yet he still moved. As it examined the strange being closer it sensed something unnatural and dangerous about him and gave a hiss in protest.

“Thank God! You saved my life buddy,” Louis rushed towards Jason but as he drew close he saw the hatchet in hand. “You aren’t here to help me are you!?!”

His back burned with pain as he moved. He wasn’t certain which would be worth the mauling of the cat or the psycho in the hockey mask. Louis turned to bolt in an attempt to choose neither but the hatchet of Jason was faster. It nearly cleaved the man’s neck from his body and left a wedge for his life to run out from.

There were still others in the woods. Things had been altered in ways he didn’t like. He threw the hatchet destroying a nearby camera but these things could be corrected.

Jason turned back to the jungle cat trying to decide what to do next. It had calmed down after the death of the man sensing a kindred spirit who had no love for man. The jaguar warily watched him ready to pouch or flee.
1532.title: Louis

info.brief_description: A variety of people go to Crystal Lake and find a not so warm welcome
info.description:
Jason stalks the shores of Crystal Lake allowing no intruders for long. Yet people keep returning to the land of the dead man. Some come for greed the land has become cheap, the price knocked down by by an endless stream of death. Others are curious, they decide to poke the bear and are shocked when the animal pokes back. Another group seeks answers, they want to find secrets of life after death but all they find is there own graves. People even come for there own reasons, it seems like a great place to hide things you never want found but often they end up buried there themselves. At last there are those who come for revenge only to find the man with the machete has many lives and they only have one.

Who will come to face the master of these lands and what fate awaits them is up for you to decide. Many are the people who have visited Crystal Lake over the years but few are the ones who are able to leave the infamous place. Beware, a killer stalks the woods and he is hard to escape and even harder to kill.
